result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamaal T Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Adjudged Delinquent Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay court costs, victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.  To be paid from bail.
*Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

Provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 09/12/14. AR

Defendant Jamaal T Jackson in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.  Defendant Jamaal T Jackson in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.

  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 year and 2 months  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year and 10 months, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 49 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid from casxh bail on deposit
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  from cash bail on deposit
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Obey all DOC rules
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Court granted defense counsel permission to appear at 1:30 if the defendant is produced for his plea hearing in the afternoon.
Justice point discharge report received and filed. lr

Attorney Christopher Lee Hartley in court, defendant Jamaal T Jackson not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PROJECTED PLEA on 9/10/2014 at 8:30 am.   Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Jamaal T Jackson in court with attorney Christopher Lee Hartley.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin. SAB
Defendant may have new pending charges. Case calendared for STATUS on 7/28/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Attorney Christopher L Hartley in court, defendant Jamaal T Jackson not in court, in custody. Karen Behling for Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant is in custody in Ozaukee County. Court waives defendant's appearance for todays proceedings. A substitution of counsel was signed by all parties and court allows Atty. Dudley to withdraw. Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 7/16/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

14RM026560  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/20/2014
Request for Substitution of Attorneys received and filed.  (Defendant requesting that Attorney Christopher L. Hartley be substituted for Attorney Dudley.)
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Attorney Donald C Dudley in court, defendant Jamaal T Jackson not in court, in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.
Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 6/30/2014 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 7/16/2014 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.

Defendant Jamaal T Jackson in court with attorney Donald C Dudley.  Defendant Jamaal T Jackson in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jamaal T Jackson in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Jamaal T Jackson in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
